Posts.Content: You know JD I felt the same way when I met the surgeon who did my Da Vinchi. Just meeting him and explaining things to me I felt the anxiety just leave my body it was really weird. Leaving his office i was like bring it on. Having the right positive attitude going into surgery is so important for the healing process. Good luck and keep us posted.

Posts.Title: 2 Days after RRP with Di Vinci

Posts.Content: I ran a fever for almost 2 weeks after surgery. They told me as long as it doesn't go above 102.5 to just take tylenol and rest. Told me that the body sometimes sees the catheter as something that shouldn't be there so it fights it. They were right about a week after the cath came out i felt like a million bucks.

Posts.Title: low-grade fever

Posts.Content: Sure feels good to get that catheter. I'm little over a week with it out myself. Question for ya,when you say a little innocence about how much. At first i was about two pads but feeling better and doing more i seem to leak more. Plus yesterday I started to notice a little bit of blood dripping. Not sure if i'm over doing it.

Posts.Title: Second PSA

Posts.Content: I'm three months out and never had any serious incontinence problems. Like Chuck said it's got to do with the skill of the surgeon and i believe that myself. Dr Lee of the University of Pennsylvania is up to 4,000 + procedures. I still have a little stress continence when i laugh real hard or i lift something heavy i get a little dribble at most. I've been a lucky man.
Posts.Signature: Age 56 Psa 1-3-13 5.6 Biopsy 2-14-13 Dre negative Results 3-1-13 3 of 12 pos. 3+3 4+3 4+3 T1c 4-24 -13 Divinchi Surgery University of Penn Dr David Lee 4-30-13 Cath removal and Final pathology report Cancer confined to prostate 2-10% gland involvement prostate 49 grams 8 lymphs tested all negative Seminal vesicle negative Perennial invasion negative Margins negatine Staging pT2b NO Mx Final Gleason 4+3
Posts.Title: continence?

Posts.Content: It was a Ahha moment for me. I had a young pretty nurse tell me to take a deep breath and out it came. It actually was not bad at all. They made me drink lots of water and had to urinate before i left the office. Make sure you bring your pads or what ever you choose to use. I was very fortunate with my incontinence,very minor leakage and no problems at night at all. Remember everybody is different so if you have problems just hang in there it will get better. I did like never having to go to the bathroom with the cath in,just drank as much as i could and did't worry about where a bathroom was. Good luck Rudy

But things turned out great for me as they will for you to. Just try to keep busy and don't let your mind wonder into negative thoughts.

Posts.Title: It's That Time Again!

Posts.Content: Hi 10bee I choose Divinci 3 weeks from yesterday for one reason Cure!!! . My numbers were higher and really had two options. Once I knew I had the right surgeon the decision was really simple. I skilled surgeon once inside can take samples of all the areas around the prostate to rule out any spreading of cancer. As you will read when they take out the prostate and do the final pathology report the Gleason score usually changes. Some times good, some times bad but at least you know for sure what you are dealing with. With radiation you get pretty much get one shot. Most if not all surgeons will not operate after radiation. You will get a lot of good advise from others on this site, this was just my experience so far. Hope this helps Rudy

Posts.Title: Surgery Scheduled-

Posts.Content: Hi everyone got the news 3-1-13. Basically i have two options radiation or surgery. Told the doctor we were going on vacation in 3 days and he said go away and try to enjoy ourselves that it was caught early. Easier said then done because he also wanted a cat scan and bone scan done. Came back from vacation and saw the doctor 3-22-13 and found out the scans were negative. (Longest days of my life) Had a lot of time to research and try to ask the right questions at the next appointment. He told me I was a T1C,3 of the 12 biopsy's were positive. 3+3 3+4 and a 4+3. Forgot to ask percentage. Dre was negative and my PSA was 5.6. And that the cancer was right side confined. Was concerned about the 4+3 but he was very reassuring we caught it early and because i already decided on da vinchi that almost always the gleason score changes after surgery and try not to get to stressed out. I really liked my urologist he is on the younger side and have read good things about him. He is in a larger group of urologist that all have some sort of awards. My only concern is that he has close to 300 surgeries with the Da vinchi and he has a senior doctor with him and they both do the surgery. I feel really comfortable him as so does my wife. Oh and i'm 56 years young. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Thanks Rudy
Posts.Title: Another new member

Posts.Content: I know exactly how you feel Mark, my 1 year date was yesterday myself. I believe there was three of use who had surgery right around the same time. Glad to hear things are going well for you. I'm also doing well myself, sometimes it feels like it was just a bad dream. Keep up the good news. Rudy

Posts.Title: One year today....

Posts.Content: Just got my labs from the doctors office and very happy to say i am still in the zero club. <0.02 he prefers the ultra sensitive test. Valentine's day is one year to the date that i got my biopsy done. Can't believe it's been a year already. Everything else is going extremely well. I'm a very lucky man. If any newbies are reading this it does get better. Kegel,Kegel and more Kegels seemed to get me through it. Good luck everybody, Rudy

Posts.Title: Great news

Posts.Content: Glad to hear the good news except for the catheter problem. Hope it's the only hiccup in the road for you.
Posts.Title: I week Post Op update

Posts.Content: Just got back from doctors office getting catheter removed and final pathology report. Doctor said it was the best outcome i could of asked for. 1. Cancer confined to prostate. 2. Seminal Vesicle invasion not identified 3. Margins uninvolved by invasion carcinoma 4. Left pelvic lymph node 3 samples no cancer 5. Right pelvic lymph node 5 samples no cancer 6. Gland involvement by carcinoma 2-10% Gleason stayed the same 4+3 7 Final pathologic staging pT2b No Mx The t2b through me off a little 1st doc said it was T1c but i guess you don't know till everything is final. Still running a low grade fever and not much of a appetite. Have to give two thumbs to Dr Lee of the University of Pennsylvania what a surgeon. I just hope everything else falls in place like the surgery did. E/d and the leaking. Thanks for all the support and I'll keep you up to date with the future PSA'S . Rudy
Posts.Title: Week after surgery update

Posts.Content: Good luck know how you feel. Getting ready for my six month test in two weeks. I'm a 4+3 myself and wish people would stop making a big deal about it. My surgeon told me as long as it was confined to the prostate don''t cause yourself unnecessary stress and live a good life. Rudy

Posts.Title: 6 Weeks Post Op

Posts.Content: Great news still part of the zero club. Doctors office just called with the good news. It was .002. Didn't know the the ultra sensitive test's took longer. That's what he wants from now on. In your mind you know everything is going to be o.k. but when they stick the needle in your arm to draw the blood the anxiety comes right back. Hope it gets easier down the road. Anyway looks like will be going out to dinner this weekend.

Posts.Title: 6 Month PSA finally came in.

Posts.Content: Surgery's tomorrow just waiting for the phone call about what time to be there. Not to anxious, knowing i have one of the best surgeons on the east coast really helps. I'll give an update when i get the cath out and lab results. Thanks for all the great info and help on this forum. Rudy
Posts.Title: My Turn :)

Posts.Content: Made the decision to get a 2nd opinion on Monday. Really liked my first doctor but only had about 300 robotic surgeries. After reading a lot of posts on this sight and meeting a friend who had the surgery one and a half years ago with great success. I called for an appointment and got one yesterday only by luck or Devine intervention. Saw Dr David Lee at the University of Pennsylvania. All i can say is WoW. What a awesome doctor with up to 3500 plus surgeries and the most humble doctor i have met. Also Met some of the team that will be helping with the producer. Took their time and explained as much as the could. He ordered a mri of my just the prostate due to my 4+3 Gleason. Said it was necessary so when he goes in he will know exactly what he's up against. (No surprises) I wanted to go to him originally but didn't think they excepted my insurance. They even hold classes for free for you and your spouse or who ever you want to explain the whole process from start to finish. They also have pryer patients come and talk to you. Just a great experience all the way around. Surgery is scheduled for 4-24-13. I liked a quote on this sight that said better to have the teacher than the student. I feel like i not only got the teacher I got the master. Thanks for listening.
Posts.Title: 2nd Opinion !!!

Posts.Content: Awesome news Mark.

Posts.Title: 6 Weeks Post Op

Posts.Content: Other factors can lead to a high psa. Overweight and bad diet are for starters. Most doctors like to wait at least a month to do a retest. Good info on this site and the web for do's and don'ts before a psa test. My psa was 5.6 and you can read my results below for my outcome. Knowledge is invaluable when dealing with doctors and insurance companies. Good luck and keep us posted. Rudy
Posts.Signature: Age 56 Psa 1-3-13 5.6 Biopsy 2-14-13 Dre negative Results 3-1-13 3 of 12 pos. 3+3 4+3 4+3 T1c 4-24 -13 Divinchi Surgery University of Penn Dr David Lee 4-30-13 Cath removal and Final pathology report Cancer confined to prostate 2-10% gland involvement prostate 49 grams 8 lymphs tested all negative Seminal vesicle negative Perennial invasion negative Margins negatine Staging pT2b NO Mx Final Gleason 4+3
Posts.Title: 5.6 psa-

Posts.Content: Good luck I know exactly how you feel. I go in this Wednesday and just ready to move on to the next phase.
Posts.Title: Surgery Monday :)

Posts.Content: Good luck Chris. Hope you have a smooth recovery,keep us up to date. Rudy

Posts.Title: Going into DaVinci now with surgeon Chris Ogden

Posts.Content: njs has a good point,my surgeon told me minimum 6 to 8 weeks after biopsy. Anyway good luck what ever you decide.

Posts.Title: Going into DaVinci now with surgeon Chris Ogden

Posts.Content: Like Ilance suggested use neosporin or Vaseline on the tip and rub a little on the catheter so when the cath moves around it keeps it lubricated. Keeps it from drying up and makes it much easier and less painless when they pull it. Try to get up and walk as much as you can asap, for me it really seemed to help. Just let the healing begin and you'll be yourself in no time.

Posts.Title: Home after my daVinci

PatientDecided.Sample: Made the decision to get a 2nd opinion on Monday. Really liked my first doctor but only had about 300 robotic surgeries....Was concerned about the 4+3 but he was very reassuring we caught it early and because i already decided on da vinchi that almost always the gleason score changes after surgery and try not to get to stressed out. I really liked my urologist he is on the younger side and have read good things about him....And that the cancer was right side confined. Was concerned about the 4+3 but he was very reassuring we caught it early and because i already decided on da vinchi that almost always the gleason score changes after surgery and try not to get to stressed out....
